intro: Niphobolus detergibilis, commonly known as the soapberry plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces smooth, green, spherical fruits that turn yellow when mature. The fruit contains a single, hard seed enclosed in a fleshy, white pulp. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
